name: Easy Pumpkin Chili
description: Pumpkin chili is hearty but light and packed with fiber and other nutrients. It's the perfect warm and cozy bowl of fall flavors.

video.name: Easy Pumpkin Chili
video.description: Pumpkin chili is hearty but light and packed with fiber and other nutrients. It's the perfect warm and cozy bowl of fall flavors.

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the garlic and dice the onion. Add the garlic, onion, and olive oil to a large pot. Saut√© the onion and garlic over medium heat until the onions are tender (about 5 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: Mince the garlic and dice the onion. Add the garlic, onion, and olive oil to a large pot. Saut√© the onion and garlic over medium heat until the onions are tender (about 5 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the ground beef and continue to cook until the beef is browned and cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the ground beef and continue to cook until the beef is browned and cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the kidney beans (drained), black beans (drained), diced tomatoes (with juices), pur√©ed pumpkin, tomato paste, water, chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and salt to the pot. Stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the kidney beans (drained), black beans (drained), diced tomatoes (with juices), pur√©ed pumpkin, tomato paste, water, chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and salt to the pot. Stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a lid on top of the pot and allow the chili to come up to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Allow the chili to simmer for 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a lid on top of the pot and allow the chili to come up to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Allow the chili to simmer for 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: After simmering for 30 minutes, give the chili a taste and add salt if needed. Serve hot with your favorite toppings (sour cream, cheese, green onion, corn chips, etc.)
recipeInstructions.name: After simmering for 30 minutes, give the chili a taste and add salt if needed. Serve hot with your favorite toppings (sour cream, cheese, green onion, corn chips, etc.)

review.reviewBody: Recipe good but prices are laughable!
Made this with beef this time & it‚Äôs even better! Accidentally thought it called for turkey last time. Oooops.

This was a huge hit in my house! Absolutely delicious!! Kid approved too, my 8 year old asked for it on leftover day!! 
The only thing I did differently was pinto beans instead of black beans because I didn‚Äôt have any on hand. Otherwise it was exact and very flavorful!

This is absolutely phenomenal! I used chicken instead of turkey as I needed to use up my chicken. Added a bit more salt at the end & topped with sharp white goat cheese instead of cow‚Äôs cheese. I heard raves all night about this recipe and I agree!  I had no idea it‚Äôs possible to find cheap recipes that are also scrumptious!
Love this one! I‚Äôve made it several times. The pumpkin adds such a nice mouthfeel.

This is delicious and have made on repeat. My son loves it as well and doesn't suspect the can of pumpkin lol. I was wondering if bell peppers can be added for extra veggies and if so should it be saut√©ed with the onions or added at the simmer stage (don't want them turning soggy). Thanks!

My vegan daughter made this as a hearty replacement for turkey at Thanksgiving. She substituted a can of chickpeas for the ground beef and the rest of the non vegan family members really liked it! I have made it twice myself‚Ä¶once vegan and once cooking the ground beef separately ( because the other family members always ask if there‚Äôs meatüòä) having 1/2 vegan and 1/2 with meat.  The recipe is sooo easy and a well stocked pantry has everything you need. Thanks for a great recipeüôèüíï.

When I first read this review after reading the others, I kinda thought it was rude how it was stated; however, I kept it in the back of my mind while making the chilli tonight. I have to say, I'm very thankful you wrote those comments bc I felt like I needed to double the spices, too. I REALLY enjoyed this chili recipe...with the extra spices.

I was all set to make this when I realized my ground beef had gone bad. So I made the recipe as written (other than the beef) and added 1/4 bag (3-4oz) of cooked lentils at the end. Thanks for the recommendation for that substitution! It turned out super tasty and filling. On a whim I served it on top of a bit of rice to make it stretch even further. I'm really pleased with how it turned out, especially after seeing the beef and thinking dinner was ruined.

I liked the lightness that the pumpkin gave this chili. However, I should have stuck to my rule of thumb of doubling the spices for Budget Bytes recipes. It definitely needed more salt at the end, and could have used double the chili spices. It was fairly bland as written (and my chili powder was a fresh bottle).
Second recipe I‚Äôve made from this site and it‚Äôs so good! I did add andouille sausage but otherwise followed exactly. Delicious‚Äô

Love this chili. I make it every few weeks this time of year.
Thank you
